scope: Regulates structures located within the buildable area of the lot
applicability: Applies to the primary daylight plane along side lot lines
Measured upward from the side lot line
exclusions: Structures located in the rear and/or side yards that qualify as accessory structures are not regulated by this rule; they are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plane (see next page)
references: Figure 20 (Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane)

Variables.name: average_grade
Variables.description: Vertical datum for daylight-plane measurement; established using the existing grade before any grading or fill
Variables.determination: Per Figure 44 p. 42; based on existing grade conditions prior to grading or fill

Variables.name: existing_grade_at_midpoint_of_wall
Variables.description: Existing grade at the midpoint of the wall of the structure

Variables.name: grade_at_nearest_point_on_adjacent_lot
Variables.description: Grade elevation at the nearest point on the adjacent lot to the side lot line
Variables.determination: Field survey of adjacent lot grade

Variables.name: side_lot_line_location
Variables.description: Horizontal location of the side property boundary used as the measurement line for the side daylight plane

Variables.name: maximum_building_height
Variables.description: Overall maximum building height limit applicable to the zone
Variables.determination: Per Municipal Code 18.12.040(a) Table 2 and related sections
Variables.source: Diagram star callout; sidebar code references

Constants.name: daylight_plane_angle_side
Constants.description: Angle of the primary daylight plane measured inward from the vertical at the side lot line

Constants.name: daylight_plane_base_height_side
Constants.description: Base elevation above average grade at the side lot line from which the 45° daylight plane begins

Constants.name: measurement_line_side
Constants.description: The side daylight plane is measured upward at the side lot line
Constants.source: Note: Side daylight plane is measured (up) at lot line

Constants.name: max_building_height_note
Constants.description: Maximum building height also applies in addition to daylight plane
Constants.source: Diagram callout: Max. building height (with star symbol)

Constants.name: ambiguous_building_code_cap
Constants.description: Text indicates a maximum allowed element is regulated by Building Code; exact element unspecified
Constants.source: Diagram callout: 'Max. allowed is [regulated] by Building Code' (middle words unclear)

Constants.name: ambiguous_24ft_cap
Constants.description: A 24' maximum is indicated for certain portions; the affected portions and condition are unclear
Constants.source: Diagram callout: '24' max. for portions [unclear remainder]'

Conditions.logic: No part of a structure located within the buildable area may extend beyond the primary side daylight plane, defined as a plane beginning 10 ft above average_grade at the side lot line and inclined inward at 45 degrees.
dependencies: average_grade determined per existing conditions prior to grading or fill (Figure 44 p. 42)
measurement taken at the side lot line

Conditions.logic: Structure must also comply with maximum_building_height and applicable setbacks in addition to the daylight plane.
dependencies: setbacks per applicable zoning standards (see 18.12.040 and related sections)

Conditions.logic: If any Building Code provision imposes a lower cap for a specific building element (e.g., guardrails, parapets, rooftop appurtenances), that Building Code cap applies.
dependencies: Ambiguous callout: 'Max. allowed is [regulated] by Building Code'

Exceptions.description: Accessory structures located in the rear and/or side yards are subject to the accessory-structure daylight plane (not the primary daylight plane).

Relationships.description: The daylight plane operates concurrently with setbacks and height limits to form an 'invisible tent' containing development.
Average grade determination method is defined elsewhere.
Dimensional standards, including maximum building height and potentially daylight plane parameters, are governed by zoning code sections.
Rear daylight plane is measured upward at the rear setback (separate rule).
Accessory-structure daylight plane applies to accessory structures in rear/side yards.

scope: Applies to all daylight planes (primary side and rear) unless otherwise specified
applicability: Establishes the vertical datum for all daylight plane measurements
references: Figure 44 p. 42 (method for establishing average grade)

Variables.name: average_grade
Variables.description: Baseline elevation from which daylight planes are measured
Variables.determination: Established using existing grade before any grading or fill per Figure 44 p. 42

Conditions.logic: Daylight plane is measured from average_grade.
dependencies: average_grade established using existing grade before grading or fill

Relationships.description: Average grade establishment procedure is defined in a separate figure.
This basis applies to the side primary daylight plane and the rear daylight plane.

scope: Defines the measurement line for the rear daylight plane
applicability: Applies to daylight plane controls along the rear of the lot

Variables.name: rear_setback_line_location
Variables.description: Location of the rear setback line at which the rear daylight plane is measured upward
Variables.determination: Per zoning setback standards for the lot

Variables.name: average_grade
Variables.description: Baseline elevation from which the rear daylight plane is measured
Variables.determination: Per Figure 44 p. 42; existing grade prior to grading or fill

Constants.name: measurement_line_rear
Constants.description: The rear daylight plane is measured upward at the rear setback line

Conditions.logic: Rear daylight plane shall be measured upward at the rear setback line from average_grade.
dependencies: average_grade established using existing grade before grading or fill per Figure 44 p. 42

Relationships.description: Side primary daylight plane uses the side lot line as the measurement line and has specified geometry (45° from 10 ft above average grade).
Rear daylight plane operates concurrently with setbacks and height limits.

ambiguity_summary.text: Max. allowed is [regulated] by Building Code
ambiguity_summary.issue: The exact element subject to Building Code maximum is not specified; the verb '[regulated]' is inferred and may not be exact.
The portions to which the 24' maximum applies and the triggering condition are not legible.
